Key Match Events: Jos Buttler and Rishabh Pant added 100-run stand in 11 overs
England bowled beautifully at the start, getting Rahul and Rohit early
Rashid finished with figures of 1 for 20 in 4 overs
Hardik Pandya smashed 50 in the last four overs but couldn't save India
England's response to India's 168 was absolutely faultless, never allowing India to get a breakthrough
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and opted to bowl, while India picked Pant ahead of Karthik
Rohit Sharma acknowledged the need to focus on getting 150 when 125-130 is considered par
Jos Buttler emphasized the importance of knowing not always to go for a 200-run total
Post-Match Reflections: India's poor start and struggles in the middle-order cost them big
England's brawny batting made it difficult for India to respond
India finished with 168-6, with Hardik Pandya contributing significantly in the death overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: India hit all of six boundaries in their first ten overs
England hit 14 boundaries in the same period and every over had a four or six
Rohit Sharma's batting against Curran was poor, with no timing on a ball that went high and short of the slips
